page.title: 19Bourtie Landscape
page.content: Most of the landscape of Bourtie near Oldmeldrum lies above 500 feet. The hill of Barra lies at 635 feet and the Bourtie hill between the old school and the Airyhillock conifer plantation is over 600 feet. The single-track bourtie road, although sheltered from the north by two coniferous forests (30 years old) and by deciduous woodland around the Old Manse 5 to 200 years old suffers extremes in weather conditions, aggravated by winds. The winter of 1981/2 made Bourtie accessible only by ski or tractor for 14 days. Telephones were disconnected and power supply was sporadic. In 1984 tractors were the only vehicles able to descend field tracks between January 4 and 13 when the Bourtie road was closed by snowdrifting. It took three days to break through 12-foot drifts between Bourtie ad Oldmeldrum.
